name: Amazon Lambda
description: The AmazonLambda Connector allows you to access the REST API of Amazon Web Service Lambda (AWS Lambda) , which lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. With Lambda, you can run code for virtually any type of application or backend service - all with zero administration. Just upload your code in one of the languages that AWS Lambda supports (currently Node.js, Java, C#, Go and Python) and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale your code with high availability.

operations.name: getAccountSettings
operations.description: Gets the settings of an account.

operations.name: createAlias
operations.description: Create an alias for a lambda function version.

operations.name: deleteAlias
operations.description: Deletes a Lambda function alias.

operations.name: getAlias
operations.description: Returns details about a Lambda function alias.

operations.name: updateAlias
operations.description: Updates the configuration of a Lambda function alias.

operations.name: init
operations.description: Config operations with common parameters.

operations.name: addPermission
operations.description: Grants an AWS service or another account permission to use a function.

operations.name: createFunction
operations.description: Creates a lambda function.

operations.name: deleteFunction
operations.description: Deletes a Lambda function.

operations.name: getFunction
operations.description: Returns information about function or function version.

operations.name: getFunctionConfiguration
operations.description: Returns the version-specific settings of a lambda function or version.

operations.name: invoke
operations.description: Invokes a lambda function.

operations.name: listFunctions
operations.description: Returns a list of Lambda functions.

operations.name: removePermission
operations.description: Removes function use permission from an AWS service or another account.

operations.name: addLayerVersionPermission
operations.description: Adds permission to the resource-based policy of a version of an AWS Lambda layer.

operations.name: removeLayerVersionPermission
operations.description: Removes a statement from the permissions policy for a version of an AWS Lambda layer.
